{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3128362,"name":"Pravit Joshi","username":"YoshiJoshi","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/y/3bc359/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T20:38:28.452Z","cooked":"

Hey guys, just wondering if we can have our first pneumatic tanks full at the start of the match. Thanks!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T20:38:28.452Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":119,"reads":341,"readers_count":340,"score":663.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423583,"topic_slug":"can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match","display_username":"Pravit Joshi","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56430,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robotics"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match/423583/1","custom_user_title":"Robotics","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3128366,"name":"Dan Katzuv","username":"dan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/eada6e/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T20:41:02.041Z","cooked":"

Rule-wise? Yes.
Practically? Yes. Just charge them in your pit before the match and pray you don‚Äôt have leaks.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T20:41:02.041Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":337,"readers_count":336,"score":87.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423583,"topic_slug":"can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match","display_username":"Dan Katzuv","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32004,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5987 Software Mentor üáÆüá±"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match/423583/2","custom_user_title":"5987 Software Mentor üáÆüá±","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128368,"name":"","username":"IanSzalai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ianszalai/{size}/210636_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T20:43:57.771Z","cooked":"

FRC pneumatic systems always leak to some extent, so if you really need pressure before a match (ie to stay in frame) then you should probably charge in queue and have a fresh battery ready.

I don‚Äôt recommend this after having to deal with charging in queue for the 2022 season.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T20:43:57.771Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":331,"readers_count":330,"score":81.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423583,"topic_slug":"can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49699,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3255A"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match/423583/3","custom_user_title":"3255A","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128369,"name":"B Roy","username":"Milquedtoast","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/milquedtoast/{size}/181388_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T20:44:27.362Z","cooked":"

Unless they changed it from previous years, you should be able to. And i would recommend always filling your tanks before matches so you battery doesn‚Äôt have to waste power and so your pneumatics can work in autonomous

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T20:44:27.362Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":324,"readers_count":323,"score":84.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":423583,"topic_slug":"can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match","display_username":"B Roy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56249,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The code person"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match/423583/4","custom_user_title":"The code person","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128379,"name":"wgorgen","username":"wgorgen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wgorgen/{size}/10106_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T21:06:19.966Z","cooked":"
IanSzalai:

FRC pneumatic systems always leak to some extent

True. But if you are careful (and a little bit lucky) you can get the leakage rate slow enough that if you charge in the pit or did not need to relieve the pressure from a previous match, you can start a match only a couple psi below the pressure switch setting that turns the compressor on. That will give you enough pressure to start the match and then the compressor will top it off very shortly after the match starts.

Our 2020 pneumatic system was probably our best (in terms of leakage). We came into the build area on Monday night to discover that the system was still pressurized at around 90 psi after sitting since Saturday noon. But in other years we have found that the robot could sit for several hours while maintaining enough pressure to not require in-queue recharging.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T21:06:19.966Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":295,"readers_count":294,"score":114.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":423583,"topic_slug":"can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match","display_username":"wgorgen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32535,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match/423583/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128422,"name":"Gavin Matthews","username":"bovlb","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bovlb/{size}/167232_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T22:19:49.267Z","cooked":"

You already got your answer, but just to tie it to the specific rules:

R608 clearly allows this:

Non-electrical sources of energy used by the ROBOT (i.e., stored at the
start of a MATCH) shall come only from the following sources:

  • A. compressed air stored in the pneumatic system that has been charged in compliance with R806 and R807,

R806 (1 onboard compressor only) says that you can‚Äôt use an off-board compressor, which was common practice in the distant past.

While R601 (1 and only 1 battery) could be read to the contrary, it seems to be common practice for teams to change their battery in the queue after compressing.

Per H302 (Teams may not tether to the ROBOT while on the FIELD), turn off your compressor and untether before entering the field gates.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T22:19:49.267Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":198,"readers_count":197,"score":109.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423583,"topic_slug":"can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match","display_username":"Gavin Matthews","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/using-pneumatics-without-compressor/425770/17","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Using pneumatics *without* compressor?","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":38743,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match/423583/6","custom_user_title":"Programming mentor, Team 2102, RI, CSA (he/him)","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128443,"name":"rwood","username":"rwood","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rwood/{size}/122197_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T22:42:18.100Z","cooked":"

Echo, what has been already said. Plus, leaks are well worth the time to investigate and eliminate. Often the students fail to push the tubing in all the way into the connectors. Proper tape or equivalent on the threads and properly smooth and square cuts on the tubing.

We always send our drive team out with an extra battery and instructions on recharging prior to the match. However we make it a priority in the pits to validate no to minimum leaks between every match.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T22:42:18.100Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":157,"readers_count":156,"score":56.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":423583,"topic_slug":"can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match","display_username":"rwood","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":30951,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 4786 Nicolet Fear Control/Programming mentor"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match/423583/7","custom_user_title":"Team 4786 Nicolet Fear Control/Programming mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128444,"name":"Troy Dietz","username":"troy_dietz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/troy_dietz/{size}/135768_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T22:44:05.405Z","cooked":"

Meh, we usually preformed a full systems check while waiting in queue. Letting the compressor run long enough to get a full charge isn‚Äôt much additional effort.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-01-17T22:44:05.405Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":138,"readers_count":137,"score":27.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":423583,"topic_slug":"can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match","display_username":"Troy Dietz","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":49699,"username":"IanSzalai","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ianszalai/{size}/210636_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26760,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"‚ù§Ô∏è conflict-free COTS"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match/423583/8","custom_user_title":"‚ù§Ô∏è conflict-free COTS","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128446,"name":"Stewart Riley","username":"Strategic","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/strategic/{size}/10157_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-17T22:46:01.483Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôm with you on this rwood. A properly setup and tested FRC pneumatic system should not leak. We‚Äôve been able to do this for the last four seasons, because the team finally started taking pneumatics seriously and putting the proper time into the system. I think many teams get leaks because they treat this part of the robot as an afterthought and don‚Äôt do the careful setup and diagnostics to make sure it works the way it should rather than ‚Äújust good enough‚Äù.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-01-18T04:05:05.400Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":130,"readers_count":129,"score":61.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":423583,"topic_slug":"can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match","display_username":"Stewart Riley","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":30951,"username":"rwood","name":"rwood","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rwood/{size}/122197_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32783,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"I plan, therefore I am"},"post_url":"/t/can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match/423583/9","custom_user_title":"I plan, therefore I am","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3128648,"name":"Big Ideas","username":"Big_Ideas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/big_ideas/{size}/156019_2.png","created_at":"2023-01-18T02:58:19.235Z","cooked":"

It is completely possible to make leak free FRC pneumatic systems. It does take care and training. Also, ‚Äúleak free‚Äù may be an inefficient rule. But, is always a good gage of workmanship and best practices.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":11,"updated_at":"2023-01-18T02:58:19.235Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":96,"readers_count":95,"score":44.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":423583,"topic_slug":"can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match","display_username":"Big Ideas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":32535,"username":"wgorgen","name":"wgorgen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/wgorgen/{size}/10106_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":10909,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/can-you-have-your-pneumatic-tanks-full-at-the-start-of-the-match/423583/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3287530,"name":"system","username":"system","avatar_template":"/uploads/default/original/4X/9/3/2/93234578e69f55873c63fc00fe2d0d85f23bce55.png","created_at":"2024-01-18T02:59:08.874Z","cooked":"
